seisflows3.scripts.examples.ex2_specfem2d_workstation_pyatoa_inversion

SEISFLOWS3 SPECFEM2D WORKSTATION EXAMPLE 2

This example will run two iterations of an inversion to assess misfit between a homogeneous halfspace model and a checkerboard model using 3 events and 132 receivers.

Note

See Example 1 docstring for more information

$ seisflows examples run 2

Classes

SF3PyatoaEx2D

A class for running SeisFlows3 examples. Overloads Example 1 to take

Attributes

sf3ex2d

class seisflows3.scripts.examples.ex2_specfem2d_workstation_pyatoa_inversion.SF3PyatoaEx2D(ntask=3, niter=2)

Bases: seisflows3.scripts.examples.ex1_specfem2d_workstation_inversion.SF3Example2D

A class for running SeisFlows3 examples. Overloads Example 1 to take advantage of the default SPECFEM2D stuff, onyl changes the generation of MODEL TRUE, the number of stations, and the setup of the parameter file.

setup_specfem2d_for_model_true(self)

Overwrites MODEL TRUE creation from EX1

Make some adjustments to the parameter file to create the final velocity model. This function assumes it is running from inside the SPECFEM2D/DATA directory

setup_seisflows_working_directory(self)

Create and set the SeisFlows3 parameter file, making sure all required parameters are set correctly for this example problem

finalize_specfem2d_par_file(self)

Final changes to the SPECFEM2D Par_file before running SeisFlows. Par_file will be used to control all the child specfem2d directories. Need to tell them to read models from .bin files, and to use existing station files rather than create them from the Par_file rather than create them from the Par_file
